member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.UsersResource.HistoryResource.ListRequest.StartHistoryId
member.summary: Required. Returns history records after the specified startHistoryId. The supplied startHistoryId should be obtained from the historyId of a message, thread, or previous list response. History IDs increase chronologically but are not contiguous with random gaps in between valid IDs. Supplying an invalid or out of date startHistoryId typically returns an HTTP 404 error code. A historyId is typically valid for at least a week, but in some rare circumstances may be valid for only a few hours. If you receive an HTTP 404 error response, your application should perform a full sync. If you receive no nextPageToken in the response, there are no updates to retrieve and you can store the returned historyId for a future request.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.UsersResource.SettingsResource.SendAsResource.Create(Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs,System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a custom "from" send-as alias. If an SMTP MSA is specified, Gmail will attempt to connect to the SMTP service to validate the configuration before creating the alias. If ownership verification is required for the alias, a message will be sent to the email address and the resource's verification status will be set to pending; otherwise, the resource will be created with verification status set to accepted. If a signature is provided, Gmail will sanitize the HTML before saving it with the alias.
This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority.
member.param: The body of the request.
User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.UsersResource.SettingsResource.SendAsResource.CreateRequest
member.summary:
Creates a custom "from" send-as alias. If an SMTP MSA is specified, Gmail will attempt to connect to the SMTP service to validate the configuration before creating the alias. If ownership verification is required for the alias, a message will be sent to the email address and the resource's verification status will be set to pending; otherwise, the resource will be created with verification status set to accepted. If a signature is provided, Gmail will sanitize the HTML before saving it with the alias.
This method is only available to service account clients that have been delegated domain-wide authority.

members.member: User's email address. The special value "me" can be used to indicate the authenticated user. [default: me]

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Label.Type
member.summary: The owner type for the label. User labels are created by the user and can be modified and deleted by the user and can be applied to any message or thread. System labels are internally created and cannot be added, modified, or deleted. System labels may be able to be applied to or removed from messages and threads under some circumstances but this is not guaranteed. For example, users can apply and remove the INBOX and UNREAD labels from messages and threads, but cannot apply or remove the DRAFTS or SENT labels from messages or threads.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Message.HistoryId
member.summary: The ID of the last history record that modified this message.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Message.Id
member.summary: The immutable ID of the message.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Message.InternalDate
member.summary: The internal message creation timestamp (epoch ms), which determines ordering in the inbox. For normal SMTP-received email, this represents the time the message was originally accepted by Google, which is more reliable than the Date header. However, for API-migrated mail, it can be configured by client to be based on the Date header.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Message.LabelIds
member.summary: List of IDs of labels applied to this message.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Message.Payload
member.summary: The parsed email structure in the message parts.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Message.Raw
member.summary: The entire email message in an RFC 2822 formatted and base64url encoded string. Returned in messages.get and drafts.get responses when the format=RAW parameter is supplied.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Message.SizeEstimate
member.summary: Estimated size in bytes of the message.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Message.Snippet
member.summary: A short part of the message text.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Message.ThreadId
member.summary: The ID of the thread the message belongs to. To add a message or draft to a thread, the following criteria must be met: - The requested threadId must be specified on the Message or Draft.Message you supply with your request. - The References and In-Reply-To headers must be set in compliance with the RFC 2822 standard. - The Subject headers must match.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePart.Body
member.summary: The message part body for this part, which may be empty for container MIME message parts.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePart.Filename
member.summary: The filename of the attachment. Only present if this message part represents an attachment.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePart.Headers
member.summary: List of headers on this message part. For the top-level message part, representing the entire message payload, it will contain the standard RFC 2822 email headers such as To, From, and Subject.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePart.MimeType
member.summary: The MIME type of the message part.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePart.PartId
member.summary: The immutable ID of the message part.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePart.Parts
member.summary: The child MIME message parts of this part. This only applies to container MIME message parts, for example multipart. For non- container MIME message part types, such as text/plain, this field is empty. For more information, see RFC 1521.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePartBody
member.summary: The body of a single MIME message part.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePartBody.AttachmentId
member.summary: When present, contains the ID of an external attachment that can be retrieved in a separate messages.attachments.get request. When not present, the entire content of the message part body is contained in the data field.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePartBody.Data
member.summary: The body data of a MIME message part as a base64url encoded string. May be empty for MIME container types that have no message body or when the body data is sent as a separate attachment. An attachment ID is present if the body data is contained in a separate attachment.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePartBody.Size
member.summary: Number of bytes for the message part data (encoding notwithstanding).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePartHeader.Name
member.summary: The name of the header before the : separator. For example, To.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.MessagePartHeader.Value
member.summary: The value of the header after the : separator. For example, someuser@example.com.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.ModifyMessageRequest.AddLabelIds
member.summary: A list of IDs of labels to add to this message.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.ModifyMessageRequest.RemoveLabelIds
member.summary: A list IDs of labels to remove from this message.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.ModifyThreadRequest.AddLabelIds
member.summary: A list of IDs of labels to add to this thread.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.ModifyThreadRequest.RemoveLabelIds
member.summary: A list of IDs of labels to remove from this thread.

member.summary: The range of messages which are accessible via POP.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.PopSettings.Disposition
member.summary: The action that will be executed on a message after it has been fetched via POP.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Profile.HistoryId
member.summary: The ID of the mailbox's current history record.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Profile.MessagesTotal
member.summary: The total number of messages in the mailbox.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Profile.ThreadsTotal
member.summary: The total number of threads in the mailbox.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs
member.summary: Settings associated with a send-as alias, which can be either the primary login address associated with the account or a custom "from" address. Send-as aliases correspond to the "Send Mail As" feature in the web interface.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs.DisplayName
member.summary: A name that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias. For custom "from" addresses, when this is empty, Gmail will populate the "From:" header with the name that is used for the primary address associated with the account.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs.IsDefault
member.summary: Whether this address is selected as the default "From:" address in situations such as composing a new message or sending a vacation auto-reply. Every Gmail account has exactly one default send-as address, so the only legal value that clients may write to this field is true. Changing this from false to true for an address will result in this field becoming false for the other previous default address.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs.IsPrimary
member.summary: Whether this address is the primary address used to login to the account. Every Gmail account has exactly one primary address, and it cannot be deleted from the collection of send-as aliases. This field is read-only.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs.ReplyToAddress
member.summary: An optional email address that is included in a "Reply-To:" header for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, Gmail will not generate a "Reply-To:" header.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs.SendAsEmail
member.summary: The email address that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias. This is read- only for all operations except create.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs.Signature
member.summary: An optional HTML signature that is included in messages composed with this alias in the Gmail web UI.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs.SmtpMsa
member.summary: An optional SMTP service that will be used as an outbound relay for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, outbound mail will be sent directly from Gmail's servers to the destination SMTP service. This setting only applies to custom "from" aliases.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs.TreatAsAlias
member.summary: Whether Gmail should treat this address as an alias for the user's primary email address. This setting only applies to custom "from" aliases.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SendAs.VerificationStatus
member.summary: Indicates whether this address has been verified for use as a send-as alias. Read-only. This setting only applies to custom "from" aliases.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmimeInfo.EncryptedKeyPassword
member.summary: Encrypted key password, when key is encrypted.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmimeInfo.Expiration
member.summary: When the certificate expires (in milliseconds since epoch).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmimeInfo.Id
member.summary: The immutable ID for the SmimeInfo.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmimeInfo.IsDefault
member.summary: Whether this SmimeInfo is the default one for this user's send-as address.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmimeInfo.IssuerCn
member.summary: The S/MIME certificate issuer's common name.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmimeInfo.Pem
member.summary: PEM formatted X509 concatenated certificate string (standard base64 encoding). Format used for returning key, which includes public key as well as certificate chain (not private key).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmimeInfo.Pkcs12
member.summary: PKCS#12 format containing a single private/public key pair and certificate chain. This format is only accepted from client for creating a new SmimeInfo and is never returned, because the private key is not intended to be exported. PKCS#12 may be encrypted, in which case encryptedKeyPassword should be set appropriately.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmtpMsa
member.summary: Configuration for communication with an SMTP service.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmtpMsa.Host
member.summary: The hostname of the SMTP service. Required.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmtpMsa.Password
member.summary: The password that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service. This is a write-only field that can be specified in requests to create or update SendAs settings; it is never populated in responses.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmtpMsa.Port
member.summary: The port of the SMTP service. Required.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmtpMsa.SecurityMode
member.summary: The protocol that will be used to secure communication with the SMTP service. Required.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.SmtpMsa.Username
member.summary: The username that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service. This is a write-only field that can be specified in requests to create or update SendAs settings; it is never populated in responses.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Thread
member.summary: A collection of messages representing a conversation.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Thread.HistoryId
member.summary: The ID of the last history record that modified this thread.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Thread.Id
member.summary: The unique ID of the thread.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Thread.Messages
member.summary: The list of messages in the thread.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.Thread.Snippet
member.summary: A short part of the message text.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.VacationSettings
member.summary: Vacation auto-reply settings for an account. These settings correspond to the "Vacation responder" feature in the web interface.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.VacationSettings.EnableAutoReply
member.summary: Flag that controls whether Gmail automatically replies to messages.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.VacationSettings.EndTime
member.summary: An optional end time for sending auto-replies (epoch ms). When this is specified, Gmail will automatically reply only to messages that it receives before the end time. If both startTime and endTime are specified, startTime must precede endTime.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.VacationSettings.ResponseBodyHtml
member.summary: Response body in HTML format. Gmail will sanitize the HTML before storing it.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.VacationSettings.ResponseBodyPlainText
member.summary: Response body in plain text format.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.VacationSettings.ResponseSubject
member.summary: Optional text to prepend to the subject line in vacation responses. In order to enable auto- replies, either the response subject or the response body must be nonempty.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.VacationSettings.RestrictToContacts
member.summary: Flag that determines whether responses are sent to recipients who are not in the user's list of contacts.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.VacationSettings.RestrictToDomain
member.summary: Flag that determines whether responses are sent to recipients who are outside of the user's domain. This feature is only available for G Suite users.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.VacationSettings.StartTime
member.summary: An optional start time for sending auto-replies (epoch ms). When this is specified, Gmail will automatically reply only to messages that it receives after the start time. If both startTime and endTime are specified, startTime must precede endTime.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.WatchRequest
member.summary: Set up or update a new push notification watch on this user's mailbox.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.WatchRequest.LabelFilterAction
member.summary: Filtering behavior of labelIds list specified.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.WatchRequest.LabelIds
member.summary: List of label_ids to restrict notifications about. By default, if unspecified, all changes are pushed out. If specified then dictates which labels are required for a push notification to be generated.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.WatchRequest.TopicName
member.summary:
A fully qualified Google Cloud Pub/Sub API topic name to publish the events to. This topic name **must** already exist in Cloud Pub/Sub and you **must** have already granted gmail "publish" permission on it. For example, "projects/my-project-identifier/topics/my-topic-name" (using the Cloud Pub/Sub "v1" topic naming format).
Note that the "my-project-identifier" portion must exactly match your Google developer project id (the one executing this watch request).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.WatchResponse.Expiration
member.summary: When Gmail will stop sending notifications for mailbox updates (epoch millis). Call watch again before this time to renew the watch.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Gmail.v1.Data.WatchResponse.HistoryId
member.summary: The ID of the mailbox's current history record.
